abstracts.cdata!:
The objectives of this project, to be
            carried out in the central Peruvian jungle highlands east of
            Lima, are to improve productivity, income and living
            conditions for about 20,000 families. This includes 2,000
            native Indian families in the area. Principal components of
            the project are: (i) provision of extension, credit and
            other agricultural support services, including marketing;
            (ii) improvement of about 427 km of rural roads and
            provision of associated maintenance equipment; (iii)
            provision of land titles; (iv) improvement of forestry
            management; (v) assistance for native communities; and (vi)
            support for project management, studies and technical
            assistance in various fields.
